post.summary:
ActivateAddon activates a marketplace addon on an account.
DEPRECATED integrate against order-fulfillment or sales-orders to activate items

ActivateApp is used to activate a marketplace app on a business
DEPRECATED integrate against order-fulfillment or sales-orders to activate items
CanActivate checks to see if a list of apps can be activated

ChangeEdition changes the currently activated app edition to a new one
DEPRECATED integrate against order-fulfillment or sales-orders to change editions
Deprecated: Create is used to activate an account.
CreateActivationEvent creates an ActivationEventV1 entity for the given item.
DeactivateAddon deactivates a marketplace addon on an account.
DeactivateAllApps is used to deactivate all marketplace apps on a business

parameters.name: body
parameters.description:
Used to deactivate all apps associated with a business in one request.
Useful for when an account was on a trial period, became delinquent, etc. and
everything needs to be deactivated, but the business should remain open.

post.summary: DeactivateApp is used to deactivate a marketplace app on a business
Deprecated: Delete is used to do a hard delete on an account.
DismissPendingActivation sets the dismissed flag and dismissed_by string
Get is used to get an account.
GetAppActivationStatusForBusiness returns the ActivationStatus for a given business scoped to application
GetBusinessesWithActiveActivationsForApp gets all businesses with active activations for the given product
GetDeactivationReasonsForApp returns the primary reasons for app deactivation.
Deprecated: EstimatedBillableRevenueInPeriod returns the estimated revenue for a given app and its addons in a given period of time based on activations data
GetMulti returns multiple Account objects for the requested app or addon activations

Get the pending activation for an app or an addon.
Note that the pending activation model, and it's status, is only applicable to an activation, not to the current state of an account.
If you need to check the current status of an account post-activation, use the Get RPC.

HandleBusinessDeleted will deactivate all items active on the account immediately, and reject any pending work for that account. This is intended to be
used in the case of the account group being deleted, to perform all the required cleanup for the account.
Deprecated: This RPC is deprecated and should not be used.
List is used to lookup a list of accounts.

ListAccountDates return important dates related to the accounts on a business
This endpoint has more downstream requirements than Get or List, thus is best effort for data.
ListActivationEventHistoryForBusiness Gets the Activation Event history for a specific account.
ListAddonActivations gets activations of an app's add-ons for a business
ListAppActivationStatusForBusiness will return all of the app and addons ActivationStatus and number of activation for that app/addon for a given business
ListCustomDeactivationReasonsForApp lists the set of custom-written deactivation reasons.
ListDeactivatedBusinessIDsForApp will return the deactivated business ids for the given app.
ListPendingActivations gets pending activations for an app or addon
ListPendingActivationsForBusiness gets pending activations for a business
ListPendingDeactivationsForAppOrAddon gets pending deactivations for an app or addon
Deprecated: ListPendingDeactivationsForPartner gets pending deactivations for a partner
DEPRECATED: The resolve billing rpc does not do anything anymore.
ResolvePendingActivation is used to accept or reject a pending activation
SuspendActivation will mark an activation as suspended
UndoCancel is used to undo a cancellation for an Activation
UnsuspendActivation will mark an activation as suspended
Deprecated: UpdateExpiry is used to expire an account.
SetAutoRenew is used to update or set the state.

ActivateProduct is used to activate a marketplace app or addon on a business, without billing for it.
This is meant only for use by other internal services, basically only order-fulfillment
Integrations that want to activate products should go through order-fulfillment or sales-orders
ActivateProductWithActivationID activates a product with the given activation ID

ChangeEdition changes the currently activated app edition to a new one, without billing for it
This is meant only for use by other service
DeactivateAppOrAddon is used to deactivate a marketplace app or addon on a business
GetMultiActivationStatuses is used to obtain status and trial information for multiple product/business id pairs
GetMultiProductActivations gets multiple activations for apps or addons within the scope of a business
GetTotalActivationsForProductsAndPartner returns the total activations for the given products and partner.
ListActiveAccounts returns a list of active accounts for a specified Product
ListActiveActivationsForProductAndBusiness gets all active activations for the given product and business

EmitActivationEvent triggers the emission of an activation event with the provided information
This RPC should only be called by the order-fulfillment microservice, or another orchestrator in the provisioning flow
EmitCancellationEvent emits a cancellation event for a given item

EmitDeactivationEvent triggers the emission of a deactivation event with the provided information
This RPC should only be called by the order-fulfillment microservice, or another orchestrator in the provisioning flow
EmitUndoCancellationEvent emits a undoCancellation event for a given item

The coming anniversary date for billing, also the date that users are going to have access until before cancelling the app

(OPTIONAL) NewBillingOrderID is the order item ID for the edition change

addonId.description:
The Addon_id of the item if the activation id belongs to an addon. Empty if the item is an app.
For addons, the app_id will be the id of its parent app.

v1Account.description:
Account is a representation of an activation in the Vendasta platform.
An activation exists in two states, an "active" state where it is available to
the purchaser, or a "deactivated" state where it's deactivated time is in the past.
Once an addon is deactivated, it is immutable moving forward.

businessId.title: The Business ID the data belongs to

appId.title: The App Id for the activation

addonId.title: Optional: The addon_id of the activation

activationId.title: The activation id of the activation

activation.title: The UTC time the account was turned on

deactivation.title: The UTC time the account was turned off

anniversaryDate.title:
The UTC time the account will renew. This is the date of the next billing period starting, based off the activation
time and the billing frequency

commitmentDate.title:
The UTC time the account is allowed to deactivate. This is based off the commitment configuration of the app, and
the activation time of the account

pendingDeactivation.description: The UTC time the account will deactivate in the future.

trialExpiration.title: The UTC time a trial will expire, if one is active

v1AccountDates.title: AccountDates is a object representing just the date information connected to an account activation

v1AddonActivation.description:
AddonActivation is a representation of a addon activation in the Vendasta platform.
An activation exists in two states, an "active" state where it is available to
the purchaser, or a "deactivated" state where it's deactivated time is in the past.
Once an addon is deactivated, it is immutable moving forward.

v1DeactivateAllAppsRequest.description:
Used to deactivate all apps associated with a business in one request.
Useful for when an account was on a trial period, became delinquent, etc. and
everything needs to be deactivated, but the business should remain open.

deactivationInfo.title: The blame information for this action

deactivationType.title: The type of deactivation to perform

activationId.description: The activationID to be deactivated. It is required when the app is multi-activatable.

reason.title: reason is the reason for deactivation

total.description: total is the number of times that reason was chosen.

businessIds.title: the IDs of the businesses who provided this reason

v1DeactivationType.description:
- DEACTIVATION_TYPE_NOT_SPECIFIED: Not Specified should not be used.
 - DEACTIVATION_TYPE_CANCEL: Cancel indicates we should turn the item off at the items anniversary date, or commitment date, whichever is later.
This ensures the item is available for the duration of the payment period.
 - DEACTIVATION_TYPE_IMMEDIATE: Immediate indicates we should turn the item off immediately. This will cause the item to clean itself up, and no
longer be available for use. The item will still be billed normally until the anniversary date, or commitment date.
 - DEACTIVATION_TYPE_IMMEDIATE_AND_STOP_BILLING: Immediate and Stop Billing indicates we should turn the item off immediately. This will cause the item to clean itself up, and no
longer be available for use. The item will no longer be billed on the anniversary date, or commitment date.
v1DeactivationType.title: Definition of the types of deactivation we support

v1PendingActivation.title:
PendingActivation is a representation of a pending activation in the Vendasta platform.
A pending activation remains pending until a "vendor" either rejects or approves the activation
